item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Nobody realizes that some people expend tremendous energy merely to be normal." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything, and the value of nothing." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Hector Berlioz
item.description:
"Time is a great teacher, but unfortunately it kills all its students."
[<i>Letter, November 1856</i>]" -- Hector Berlioz

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Conan O'Brien
item.description: "If you work really hard, and you're kind, amazing things will happen." -- Conan O'Brien

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Charles Eames
item.description: "Eventually everything connects - people, ideas, objects. The quality of the connections is the key to quality per se." -- Charles Eames

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by May Sarton
item.description: "Do not deprive me of my age. I have earned it." -- May Sarton

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Yoko Ono
item.description: "Spring passes and one remembers one's innocence. Summer passes and one remembers one's exuberance. Autumn passes and one remembers one's reverence. Winter passes and one remembers one's perseverance." -- Yoko Ono

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Theophile Gautier
item.description: "It is difficult to obtain the friendship of a cat. It is a philosophical animal... one that does not place its affections thoughtlessly." -- Theophile Gautier

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "You think your pain and your heartbreak are unprecedented in the history of the world, but then you read. It was books that taught me that the things that tormented me most were the very things that connected me with all the people who were alive, or who had ever been alive." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by James A. Baldwin
item.description: "Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war; love is a growing up." -- James A. Baldwin

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by W.G. Sebald
item.description: "It seems to me then as if all the moments of our life occupy the same space, as if future events already existed and were only waiting for us to find our way to them at last, just as when we have accepted an invitation we duly arrive in a certain house at a given time." -- W.G. Sebald

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Well, art is art, isn't it? Still, on the other hand, water is water! And east is east and west is west and if you take cranberries and stew them like applesauce they taste much more like prunes than rhubarb does. Now, uh... now you tell me what you know." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "when I am feeling low all i have to do is watch my cats and my courage returns" -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Issa
item.description: "Arise from sleep, old cat, And with great yawns and stretchings... Amble out for love" -- Issa

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Colette
item.description: "I went to collect the few personal belongings which...I held to be invaluable: my cat, my resolve to travel, and my solitude." -- Colette

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Studs Terkel
item.description: "Work is about a search for daily meaning as well as daily bread, for recognition as well as cash, for astonishment rather than torpor; in short, for a sort of life rather than a Monday through Friday sort of dying." -- Studs Terkel
